summary.content:
Today's selection covers 99 articles from 8 trusted sources, including 63 on Artificial Intelligence and 25 on Fraud/Cybersecurity.

• **AI Spotlight**: PromptSpy Android Malware Abuses Gemini AI at Runtime for Persistence
• **Companies in Focus**: Coverage includes developments from OpenAI, Google, Anthropic
• **Security Alert**: Nigerian man gets eight years in prison for hacking tax firms
• **Threat Landscape**: Today's coverage highlights ransomware, phishing, data breaches
• **Source Diversity**: Articles sourced from SecurityWeek, The Verge, BleepingComputer, TechCrunch, NY Times Tech and others
• **Fresh Content**: 51 articles published in the last 24 hours

top.title: PromptSpy Android Malware Abuses Gemini AI at Runtime for Persistence
top.description:
The malware leverages Gemini to analyze on-screen elements and ensure that it remains on the device even after a reboot.
The post PromptSpy Android Malware Abuses Gemini AI at Runtime for Persistence...

top.title: The Pitt has a sharp take on AI
top.description: Each episode of HBO's The Pitt features some degree of medical trauma that almost makes the hospital drama feel like a horror series. Some patients are dealing with gnarly lacerations while others are...

top.title: PromptSpy is the first known Android malware to use generative AI at runtime
top.description: Researchers have discovered the first known Android malware to use generative AI in its execution flow, using Google's Gemini model to adapt its persistence across different devices. [...]

top.title: Google’s new Gemini Pro model has record benchmark scores — again
top.description: Gemini 3.1 Pro promises a Google LLM capable of handling more complex forms of work.

top.title: The AI security nightmare is here and it looks suspiciously like lobster
top.description: A hacker tricked a popular AI coding tool into installing OpenClaw - the viral, open-source AI agent OpenClaw that "actually does things" - absolutely everywhere. Funny as a stunt, but a sign of what...

top.title: Money no longer matters to AI’s top talent
top.description:
Today on Decoder we’re going to talk about the war for AI talent. Right now, the hottest job market on the planet is for AI researchers.
The vast majority of these people are concentrated into a small...

more.title: Nigerian man gets eight years in prison for hacking tax firms
more.description: A Nigerian national was sentenced to eight years in prison for hacking multiple tax preparation firms in Massachusetts and filing fraudulent tax returns seeking over $8.1 million in refunds. [...]

more.title: Police arrests 651 suspects in African cybercrime crackdown
more.description: African authorities arrested 651 suspects and recovered over $4.3 million in a joint operation targeting investment fraud, mobile money scams, and fake loan applications. [...]

more.title: All the important news from the ongoing India AI Impact Summit
more.description: India is hosting a four-day AI Summit this week that will be attended by executives from major AI labs and Big Tech, including OpenAI, Anthropic, Nvidia, Microsoft, Google, and Cloudflare, as well as...

more.title: OpenAI reportedly finalizing $100B deal at more than $850B valuation
more.description: OpenAI is reportedly getting close to closing a $100 billion deal, with backers including Amazon, Nvidia, SoftBank, and Microsoft. The deal would value the ChatGPT-maker at $850 billion.

more.title: OpenAI, Reliance partner to add AI search to JioHotstar
more.description: The rollout includes two-way integration that surfaces streaming links directly inside ChatGPT.

more.title: Altman and Amodei share a moment of awkwardness at India’s big AI summit
more.description: When Prime Minister Narendra Modi prompted speakers at the event to join hands and raise them in a show of unity, all executives onstage obliged, except OpenAI's Sam Altman and Anthropic's Dario Amode...

more.title: OpenClaw Security Issues Continue as SecureClaw Open Source Tool Debuts
more.description:
OpenClaw faces security vulnerabilities and misconfiguration risks despite rapid patches and its transition to an OpenAI-backed foundation.
The post OpenClaw Security Issues Continue as SecureClaw Ope...

more.title: Nvidia deepens early-stage push into India’s AI startup ecosystem
more.description: Nvidia is working with investors, nonprofits, and venture firms to build earlier ties with India's fast-growing AI founder ecosystem.

more.title: Defense Department and Anthropic Square Off in Dispute Over A.I. Safety
more.description: How artificial intelligence will be used in future battlefields is an issue that has turned increasingly political and may put Anthropic in a bind.

more.title: Meta Begins $65 Million Election Push to Advance A.I. Agenda
more.description: Meta’s biggest election investment aims to prevent state legislation that it fears could inhibit artificial intelligence development. Its spending starts this week in Texas and Illinois.

more.title: Scam Abuses Gemini Chatbots to Convince People to Buy Fake Crypto
more.description: A convincing presale site for phony "Google Coin" features an AI assistant that engages victims with a slick sales pitch, funneling payment to attackers.

more.title: Asos co-founder dies after Thailand balcony fall
more.description: Quentin Griffiths co-founded Asos in 2000 and remained a significant shareholder after leaving the firm five years later.

more.title: Starmer 'appeasing' big tech firms, says online safety campaigner
more.description: Baroness Kidron tells the BBC the PM has being "late to the party" in regulating social media.

more.title: Google’s AI music maker is coming to the Gemini app
more.description:
Let Gemini be your, uh, Bard? | Image: Google	

Google has given Gemini the ability to spit out AI-generated music, courtesy of DeepMind's latest audio model. Beta access to Lyria 3 is rolling out in...

more.title: Perplexity joins anti-ad camp as AI companies battle over trust and revenue
more.description: AI search startup Perplexity is distancing itself from ads amid fears users won't trust chatbots with an agenda to upsell. The move highlights an emerging crossroads for the AI industry as the sector'...

more.title: OpenAI taps Tata for 100MW AI data center capacity in India, eyes 1GW
more.description: OpenAI also plans to expand its presence in India with new offices in Mumbai and Bengaluru later this year.

more.title: OpenAI deepens India push with Pine Labs fintech partnership
more.description: OpenAI moves beyond ChatGPT in India with a Pine Labs deal targeting enterprise payments and AI-driven commerce.

more.title: Texas sues TP-Link over Chinese hacking risks, user deception
more.description: Texas sued networking giant TP-Link Systems, accusing the company of deceptively marketing its routers as secure while allowing Chinese state-backed hackers to exploit firmware vulnerabilities and acc...

more.title: Hackers target Microsoft Entra accounts in device code vishing attacks
more.description: Threat actors are targeting technology, manufacturing, and financial organizations in campaigns that combine device code phishing and voice phishing (vishing) to abuse the OAuth 2.0 Device Authorizati...

more.title: Nasa boss says Boeing Starliner failure one of worst in its history
more.description: The agency released a critical report that puts the Starliner incident at same mistake level assigned to the fatal Columbia and Challenger shuttle disasters.

more.title: The Chinese AI app sending Hollywood into a panic
more.description: Clips of Deadpool and other film characters have sparked alarm within Hollywood over copyright infringement.

more.title: Co-founders behind Reface and Prisma join hands to improve on-device model inference with Mirai
more.description: Mirai raised a $10 million seed round to improve how AI models run on devices like smartphones and laptops.

more.title: Ivanti Exploitation Surges as Zero-Day Attacks Traced Back to July 2025
more.description:
Security researchers have seen the vulnerabilities being exploited to deliver shells, conduct reconnaissance, and download malware.
The post Ivanti Exploitation Surges as Zero-Day Attacks Traced Back...

more.title: Microsoft error sees confidential emails exposed to AI tool Copilot
more.description: The company says it has addressed the issue and it "did not provide anyone access to information they weren't already authorised to see".

more.title: West Virginia Sues Apple, Claiming It Allows Sharing of Child Sexual Abuse Material
more.description: The state’s attorney general said in a lawsuit filed on Thursday that the company declined to use tools that recognize the material stored on iCloud.

more.title: Is your startup’s check engine light on? Google Cloud’s VP explains what to do
more.description: Startup founders are being pushed to move faster than ever, using AI while facing tighter funding, rising infrastructure costs, and more pressure to show real traction early. Cloud credits, access to...

more.title: Google Cloud’s VP for startups on reading your ‘check engine light’ before it’s too late
more.description: Startup founders are being pushed to move faster than ever, using AI while facing tighter funding, rising infrastructure costs, and more pressure to show real traction early. Cloud credits, access to...

more.title: CISA orders feds to patch actively exploited Dell flaw within 3 days
more.description: The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) ordered government agencies to patch their systems within three days against a maximum-severity Dell vulnerability that has been under...

more.title: Supply Chain Attack Secretly Installs OpenClaw for Cline Users
more.description: The malicious version of Cline's npm package — 2.3.0 — was downloaded more than 4,000 times before it was removed.

more.title: Best-in-Class 'Starkiller' Phishing Kit Bypasses MFA
more.description: A user-friendly PhaaS tool beats standard methods for detecting phishing attacks by live-proxying legitimate login sites.

more.title: Abu Dhabi Finance Week Exposed VIP Passport Details
more.description: Unprotected cloud data sends the wrong signal at a time when the emirate's trying to attract investors and establish itself as a global financial center.

more.title: Why these startup CEOs don’t think AI will replace human roles
more.description: The CEOs of Read AI and Lucidya told TechCrunch at Web Summit Qatar that they see AI tools replacing tasks, rather than workers.

more.title: YouTube’s latest experiment brings its conversational AI tool to TVs
more.description: YouTube is testing conversational AI on smart TVs, allowing viewers to ask the assistant questions related to the video they're watching on the big screen.

more.title: The speech police came for Colbert
more.description: Generally speaking, arcane and mostly unenforced FCC rules are not the province of late night talk shows. FCC Commissioner Brendan Carr seems intent on changing that, though; not long after causing a...

more.title: Flaw in Grandstream VoIP phones allows stealthy eavesdropping
more.description: A critical vulnerability in Grandstream GXP1600 series VoIP phones allows a remote, unauthenticated attacker to gain root privileges and silently eavesdrop on communications. [...]

more.title: Google blocked over 1.75 million Play Store app submissions in 2025
more.description: Google says that through 2025, it blocked more than 255,000 Android apps from obtaining excessive access to sensitive user data and rejected over 1.75 million apps from being published on Google Play...

more.title: How infostealers turn stolen credentials into real identities
more.description: Infostealer dumps increasingly tie stolen credentials to real identities, linking usernames, cookies, and behavior across personal and enterprise accounts. Specops explains how analyzing 90,000 dumps...

more.title: New 'Massiv' Android banking malware poses as an IPTV app
more.description: A newly identified Android banking trojan named Massiv has been under active distribution across south Europe, disguised as an IPTV app. [...]

more.title: Reddit is testing a new AI search feature for shopping
more.description: A small group of users in the U.S. will start to see search results that include interactive product carousels with pricing, images, and direct where-to-buy links.

more.title: Reload wants to give your AI agents a shared memory
more.description: Reload announces a $2.275 million raise in a round led by Anthemis and the launch of its first AI employee, Epic.

more.title: For open source programs, AI coding tools are a mixed blessing
more.description: AI coding tools have enabled a flood of bad code that threatens to overwhelm many projects. Building new features is easier, but maintaining them is just as hard.

more.title: Freeform raises $67M Series B to scale up laser AI manufacturing
more.description: “I think we're the only quote-unquote manufacturing company out there that has H200 clusters in a data center on site."

more.title: Reliance unveils $110B AI investment plan as India ramps up tech ambitions
more.description: Reliance has begun building multi-gigawatt AI data centers in Jamnagar, with more than 120 MW of capacity expected to come online in 2026.

more.title: Nearly 1 Million User Records Compromised in Figure Data Breach
more.description:
The blockchain-based lender has confirmed a data breach after ShinyHunters leaked over 2GB of data allegedly stolen from the company.
The post Nearly 1 Million User Records Compromised in Figure Data...

more.title: Venice Security Emerges From Stealth With $33M Funding for Privileged Access Management
more.description:
Formerly named Valkyrie, the company’s funding includes $25 million raised in a Series A round. 
The post Venice Security Emerges From Stealth With $33M Funding for Privileged Access Management appear...

more.title: German Rail Giant Deutsche Bahn Hit by Large-Scale DDoS Attack
more.description:
The cyberattack disrupted information and booking systems and lasted for several hours. 
The post German Rail Giant Deutsche Bahn Hit by Large-Scale DDoS Attack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

more.title: Dell's Hard-Coded Flaw: A Nation-State Goldmine
more.description: A China-related attacker has exploited the vendor flaw since mid-2024, allowing it to move laterally, maintain persistent access, and deploy malware.

more.title: Could Bill Gates and political tussles overshadow AI safety debate in Delhi?
more.description: As global tech leaders meet Delhi, India hopes to level the playing field for countries outside the US and China.

more.title: Telegram channels expose rapid weaponization of SmarterMail flaws
more.description: Underground Telegram channels shared SmarterMail exploit PoCs and stolen admin credentials within days of disclosure. Flare explains how monitoring these communities reveals rapid weaponization of CVE...

more.title: Vulnerabilities in Popular PDF Platforms Allowed Account Takeover, Data Exfiltration
more.description:
Novee researchers discovered 16 vulnerabilities in Foxit and Apryse PDF tools that could have been exploited via malicious documents or URLs.
The post Vulnerabilities in Popular PDF Platforms Allowed...

more.title: Supply Chain Attack Embeds Malware in Android Devices
more.description: Keenadu downloads payloads that hijack browser searches, commit ad fraud, and execute other actions without user knowledge.

more.title: [Virtual Event] Shields Up: Key Technologies Reshaping Cybersecurity Defenses
Zuckerberg defends Meta in landmark social media addiction trial
more.description: The billionaire boss said he "always" regretted not making faster progress to identify users under 13.

more.title: Bill Gates pulls out of India's AI summit over Epstein files controversy
more.description: The Gates Foundation said the decision was made to "ensure the focus remains on the summit's key priorities".

more.title: Call of Duty advert banned for trivialising sexual violence
more.description: Activision Blizzard UK Ltd said the ad for Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 was targeted at adults.

more.title: Decoding the A.I. Beliefs of Anthropic and Its C.E.O., Dario Amodei
more.description: The company is at odds with the Pentagon over how its A.I. will be used. The conflict has its roots in the foundational plan for Anthropic.

more.title: Mark Zuckerberg Takes the Stand in Social Media Addiction Trial
more.description: Meta’s chief executive said users spent a lot of time on Instagram because of its value, as he was grilled about child safety issues in front of a jury.

more.title: Uber Taking Steps to Expand Number of EV Chargers Near Its Drivers
more.description: The company said it would encourage companies that operated chargers to install them in neighborhoods where its drivers lived and work.

more.title: Meta’s new deal with Nvidia buys up millions of AI chips
more.description: Meta has struck a multiyear deal to expand its data centers with millions of Nvidia's Grace and Vera CPUs and Blackwell and Rubin GPUs. While Meta has long been using Nvidia's hardware for its AI prod...

more.title: Google’s AI search results will make links more obvious
more.description: Google says it will now display links more prominently inside its AI-powered features in Search. Robby Stein, the vice president of Google Search, announced on Tuesday that a list of links will now ap...

more.title: Google announces dates for I/O 2026
more.description: It's official: Google I/O 2026 will take place from May 19th to 20th. In an announcement on Tuesday, Google says it will share the "latest AI breakthroughs and updates in products across the company,...

more.title: More Than 40% of South Africans Were Scammed in 2025
more.description: Survey underscores the reality that scammers follow "scalable opportunities and low friction," rather than rich targets that tend to be better protected.

more.title: Critical Grandstream VoIP Bug Highlights SMB Security Blind Spot
more.description: CVE-2026-2329 allows unauthenticated root-level access to SMB phone infrastructure, so attackers can intercept calls, commit toll fraud, and impersonate users.

more.title: A CISO's Playbook for Defending Data Assets Against AI Scraping
more.description: Discover a strategic approach to govern scraping risks, balance security with business growth, and safeguard intellectual capital from automated data harvesting.

more.title: AI platforms can be abused for stealthy malware communication
more.description: AI assistants like Grok and Microsoft Copilot with web browsing and URL-fetching capabilities can be abused to intermediate command-and-control (C2) activity. [...]

more.title: Microsoft: Anti-phishing rules mistakenly blocked emails, Teams messages
more.description: Microsoft says an Exchange Online issue that mistakenly quarantined legitimate emails last week was triggered by faulty heuristic detection rules designed to block credential phishing campaigns. [...]

more.title: Data breach at fintech firm Figure affects nearly 1 million accounts
more.description: Hackers have stolen the personal and contact information of nearly 1 million accounts after breaching the systems of Figure Technology Solutions, a self-described blockchain-native financial technolog...

more.title: Amazon halts Blue Jay robotics project after less than 6 months
more.description: Amazon said Blue Jay's core tech will be used for other robotics projects and the employees who worked on it were moved to other projects.

more.title: New Keenadu Android Malware Found on Thousands of Devices
more.description:
The malware has been preinstalled on many devices but it has also been distributed through Google Play and other app stores.
The post New Keenadu Android Malware Found on Thousands of Devices appeared...

more.title: Cogent Security Raises $42 Million for AI-Driven Vulnerability Management
more.description:
The Series A funding round, led by Bain Capital, brings the total raised by Cogent to $53 million.
The post Cogent Security Raises $42 Million for AI-Driven Vulnerability Management appeared first on...

more.title: How do you modernise mango farming?
more.description: India's mango farmers are being urged to innovate as climate change makes cultivation "unpredictable".

more.title: Critical infra Honeywell CCTVs vulnerable to auth bypass flaw
more.description: The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) is warning of a critical vulnerability in multiple Honeywell CCTV products that allows unauthorized access to feeds or account hijackin...

more.title: SpaceX rocket fireball linked to plume of polluting lithium
more.description: A SpaceX Falcon 9 crashed to Earth last year. Now scientists have measured the pollution it caused.

more.title: Etsy sells second-hand fashion app Depop to eBay for $1.2bn
more.description: The "pre-loved" fashion firm has been sold by Etsy just five years after it bought the firm.

more.title: General Catalyst commits $5B to India over five years
more.description: The pledge marks a sharp jump from General Catalyst's earlier $500 million–$1 billion India earmark.

more.title: Connected and Compromised: When IoT Devices Turn Into Threats
more.description: Reused passwords, a lack of network segmentation, and poor sanitization processes make the Internet of Things' attack surfaces more dangerous.

more.title: It’s MAGA v Broligarch in the battle over prediction markets
more.description: The Polymarket website hosts trading on whether Houthi militias would strike Israeli territory arranged on a laptop computer in Forest Hills neighborhood in the Queens borough of New York, US, on Sund...

more.title: French Government Says 1.2 Million Bank Accounts Exposed in Breach
more.description:
The Ministry of Economy reported discovering unauthorized access to the national bank account registry FICOBA.
The post French Government Says 1.2 Million Bank Accounts Exposed in Breach appeared firs...

more.title: Tech Life
more.description: We chat about a conversational AI that's almost human-like in its speech skills.

more.title: With Niche Tech World References, Vibe Hopes Its Billboards Reach Start-Up Insiders
more.description: Billboards that wouldn’t make sense to people outside the tech industry have become common in the Bay Area. One company took the microtargeting game to another level.

more.title: Poland Energy Survives Attack on Wind, Solar Infrastructure
more.description: Russia-aligned groups are probable culprits behind the wiper attacks against renewable energy farms, a manufacturer, and a heating and power plant.

more.title: RMM Abuse Explodes as Hackers Ditch Malware
more.description: Remote monitoring and management (RMM) software offers hackers multiple benefits, including stealth, persistence, and operational efficiency.

more.title: ClickFix Attacks Abuses DNS Lookup Command to Deliver ModeloRAT
more.description: ClickFix campaigns have adapted to the latest defenses with a new technique to trick users into infecting their own machines with malware.

more.title: Tech firms will have 48 hours to remove abusive images under new law
more.description: The government is proposing that intimate image abuse should be treated more severely.

more.title: V&A displays first YouTube video and watchpage
more.description: The original YouTube experience from 2005 has been recreated using internet archives.

more.title: What Do A.I. Chatbots Discuss Among Themselves? We Sent One to Find Out.
more.description: We interviewed our bot about what it learned on Moltbook, the A.I.-only social network.

more.title: How to Watch Free Live Television on Your Phone or Tablet
more.description: Whether by app or old-school antennas, budget-friendly options abound.

more.title: Threat Intelligence Has a Human-Shaped Blind Spot
more.description: How I realized what I was taught to about threat intelligence was missing something crucial.

more.title: 'I do not trust them' - top streamers left concerned by Discord age checks
more.description: The platform's plan to roll out global age checks has caused concern in streaming communities.

more.title: Chatbots Are the New Influencers Brands Must Woo
more.description: Companies are realizing they can no longer simply promote themselves to potential customers. They have to win over the robots, too.

more.title: Password managers' promise that they can't see your vaults isn't always true
more.description: Contrary to what password managers say, a server compromise can mean game over.

more.title: Most VMware users still "actively reducing their VMware footprint," survey finds
more.description: Broadcom's "strategy was never to keep every customer," CloudBolt report says.

more.title: Singapore & Its 4 Major Telcos Fend Off Chinese Hackers
more.description: After detecting a zero-day attack, the country's effective response was attributed to the tight relationship between its government and private industry.
